questions.question: Your company AI strategy is comprehensive.
Your company AI roadmap has clearly defined time bounds.
Your company AI roadmap has clearly defined ROI targets.
Your company AI roadmap is approved by the C-level executives.
Your company has a dedicated AI development budget.
Your company AI strategy is broadly known by its employees.
What companies are top of mind in the area of AI strategy consulting?
Which of your peers / competitors do you think have come the furthest in their AI strategy?
Your company recruits AI talent primarily through recruiting agencies.
New AI talents have an onboarding process to become effective quickly.
Your company has the AI talent in place to capitalize on the most cutting edge AI systems possible today.
AI talents have career development paths aimed at keeping them highly motivated.
Your company makes a clear distinction between centralized and decentralized AI competence.
Your company has a strategy for attracting more AI talent than its competitors.
Individuals with a history of highly successful AI projects are tasked with screening potential new hires.
Your company has a strategy in place for increasing the AI competence of its technical employees.
Your company continuously produces and collects data through departments with customer contact?
Your company uses tools to specify and manage data-lifecycles.
Your company uses tools to track data-lineage.
Your company uses tools to version control data.
Your company uses tools to manage business-approved data-processing algorithms.
Your company uses the same tools to manage both internal and external data sources.
Your company controls access to data using centralized authentication and authorization.
Your company has a data-archiving strategy that includes everything from date formats to binary serialization.
Your company continuously produces and collects data through departments with customer contact?
Your company uses tools to specify and manage data-lifecycles.
Your company uses tools to track data-lineage.
Your company uses tools to version control data.
Your company uses tools to manage business-approved data-processing algorithms.
Your company uses the same tools to manage both internal and external data sources.
Your company controls access to data using centralized authentication and authorization.
Your company has a data-archiving strategy that includes everything from date formats to binary serialization.
Your company develops AI-capabilities that are reusable.
Your company catalogues and tracks each AI-system lifecycle.
Your company monitors its AI-systems through business KPIs.
Your company ensures data quality through master data management.
Your company has separate development environments for rapid prototyping.
Your company architects IT systems so they can be replaced with minimal effort.
Your company can implement new AI capabilities more quickly than its competitors.
Your company requires all code to be version controlled, documented, and pass unit / integration tests
Your company uses AI evangelists to communicate learnings and replicate successful AI projects internally.
Your company has a strategy for increasing AI literacy (competence/understanding?) across non-technical personnel.
Your company has established industry partnerships with trusted technology experts in order to extend its AI development capabilities.
Your company has centralized processes to ensure compliance with privacy guidelines, GDPR, and more.
Your company has infosec processes in place which govern AI development.
Your company has a dedicated research and new-growth budget.
Your company leverages AI to reach sustainability goals.
Your company has a dedicated AI ethics manager.
